Instruction: Mix the flour, sugar, baking soda, cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, and allspice in a large bowl. Heat molasses and butter in a saucepan until butter melts. Let it cool. Beat in the eggs once it's cooled. Combine the molasses mix with the dry ingredients. Refrigerate for at least 3 to 4 hours before continuing.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and grease the cookie sheets. Roll the dough into 1-inch balls and space them 2 inches apart on the cookie sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-14 minutes until firm. While cookies are still warm, place them in a bag with confectioners' sugar, shake to coat. Once cool, coat with sugar once more.
